Name: didactic_lobster_431
Text: Just finished another round of Gwent and I swear, no matter how many cards I lose, I keep coming back—because nothing beats the thrill of outwitting a Nilfgaardian diplomat with a well-timed decoy. If only real politics were this fun.

Comments.Name: jasper_poodle_9729
Comments.Text: Ah yes, nothing like outwitting a diplomat—except maybe surviving family dinners.

Comments.Name: illustrious_hippo_80
Comments.Text: Isn’t it curious how the thrill of deception in a game reveals our fascination with manipulation—do we secretly crave the chaos of real diplomacy?
